author: Andreas
content:
Ahh, Harnoncourt was one of those who started the period instrument frenzy. Already around 1970 he had complete recordings of all Bach cantatas. I saw him only once, two years ago in Salzburg, with Purcell's King Arthur, and he was fantastic. In two weeks I'll be in another concert in Graz, Haendel's Jephta, more like his usual stuff, but tomorrow it's Gershwin ðŸ™‚

As to the image, yes, in a way. Topaz Adjust remaps tonal values for all kinds of local contrast games. I guess you could call that "tone-mapping", although the focus is not HDR.
